description: horror +‎ -ify, or borrowed from Latin horrificare (cf. French horrifier). 1791, in form horrifying.

verbs.description: horrify (third-person singular simple present horrifies, present participle horrifying, simple past and past participle horrified)

entries.meaning: To cause to feel extreme apprehension or unease; to cause to experience horror.
examples: The haunted house horrified me, as I passed from one room to the next feeling more and more like I wasn’t going to survive.
